title: Offline cache shows up in gallery applications
body:
When saving comics or What if for offline use, the respective files show up in your typical gallery app (the one preinstalled on an average Android device, [Simple Gallery](https://github.com/SimpleMobileTools/Simple-Gallery), etc).

To fix this, all that has to be done is placing an empty `.nomedia` file in the folder that the image is stored in. This will cause the Android media scanner to ignore the files in that folder.

title: Inefficient API is used
body:
Dear developers,

I found an inefficient API, setImageResource(), is used in Easy_xkcd. 

For setImageResource(), Google says this: 

https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/ImageView.html
" This does Bitmap reading and decoding on the UI thread, which can cause a latency hiccup. If that's a concern, consider using setImageDrawable(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable) or setImageBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap) and BitmapFactory instead. "

Suggestion for overview mode
body:
I don't know how far you are with implementing a better overview mode, but I just noticed there already is a pretty good list-based one: the search results.
If you search something, then search again (from the search activity), and finally clear your search you'll get a satisfying list of all comics out there.

Of course, there might be a grid-based one too, and the user can select which is shown with an entry in the settings.

title: Lime theme needs dark font in toolbar
body:
According to the [guidelines](https://www.google.com/design/spec/style/color.html#color-color-palette) the lime theme should use a dark font for better contrast. Technically the green theme is affected as well, but I think the contrast is fine there and having white font on the darker (700-tone) system bar and black font in the toolbar right below probably looks weird.

I looked at the source, but could not find an easy fix. The dark actionbar theme seems to be hardcoded in `tool_bar.xml` and the parents of the styles in `styles.xml` seem to be ignored, since only single values are extracted from those custom styles.
